title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Siemens Executive and His Family Died in Hudson Helicopter Crash
items.description: Agustín Escobar was killed on Thursday along with his wife and their three children, who have not been publicly named. The pilot also died in the cras...

items.title: Trump’s New Plan for Social Security Death List, and China’s Counterattack on Tariffs
items.description: Plus, Hollywood stunts in the spotlight.

items.title: Marine Le Pen’s ‘Witch Hunt’ Talk Echoes Trump. Will It Work in France?
items.description: After years trying to moderate her party’s image, the far-right leader, convicted of embezzlement, now voices Trump-like outrage, at some risk.

items.title: Steeling China for a Tariff Fight, Xi Faces His Biggest Test Since Covid
items.description: Xi Jinping has refused to back down in China’s tariff confrontation with President Trump. But he’ll have to persuade his people that the pain is worth...

items.title: Trump’s Tariffs Are Part of a ‘Tectonic Plate Shift’ in the Global Economy
items.description: Peter R. Orszag, the C.E.O. of Lazard, discusses how markets are reacting to the uncertainty of Trump’s tariffs.

items.title: Inside the bond market’s $800 billion ‘murder mystery.’ Here’s why the basis trade could be a time bomb—and what the Fed can do to stop it
items.description: One of Trump’s head economists said the spike in yields added “urgency” to the decision to pause the president’s reciprocal tariffs.

items.title: Trump’s trade war with China begins — and Apple, Tesla, and US stocks are the first major casualties
items.description: Also: Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For, Apple’s supply chain is trapped.

items.title: How does a Fortune 500 company rebuild their supply chain overnight? Most are piecing together a playbook on the fly
items.description: “Almost every client I talk to has a war room,” says Mary Rollman, KPMG’s U.S. supply chain leader.

items.title: Publishers Clearing House using bankruptcy to pivot away from legacy business of direct-mail, retail merchandise and magazine subscriptions
items.description: The Chapter 11 proceedings, filed in New York on Wednesday, arrive amid growing financial strain for PCH.

items.title: The no.1 strategy to employ at work as incivility mounts with return to office
items.description: Dr. Becky says we need to stop running from workplace conflict.

items.title: Germany Is Falling Apart (Literally). Here’s How the New Government Might Fix It.
items.description: Friedrich Merz, the incoming chancellor, persuaded lawmakers to let him spend more. Infrastructure will be the first order of business.

items.title: Trump Envoy Steve Witkoff Is in Russia, the Kremlin Says
items.description: The Kremlin spokesman would not say whether the Trump aide, Steve Witkoff, would meet with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
